title: How to Make Popcorn

methods.name: Quick and Cheap DIY Paper Method

steps.headline: Buy some brown paper bags (lunch bags), but make sure the package is labeled as being microwave-safe.
steps.description: Bags not meant for use in the microwave can catch on fire.

steps.headline: Pour 1/4 to 1/3 cup kernels to the bag.
Place the bag on its side in your microwave.
Cook on high for several minutes.
steps.description: This time varies, depending on your microwave. Do not leave the bag unattended. Stop the microwave when the pops are about 2 seconds apart, and remove the bag from the oven.

steps.headline: Pour the popcorn into a bowl and top it with butter and/or seasoning(s).
Follow the instructions on the bag, which typically recommend the following:
steps.description: Massage the bag with your fingertips to break up the mixture before placing it in a microwave. Set the microwave for a few seconds longer than recommended, listen carefully, and stop the microwave when the pops are about 2 seconds apart. Remove the popcorn from the bag immediately for flavor. Open the bag away from you (the steam is hot), then serve and enjoy!

steps.headline: Use a pan with a lid, preferably a lid with holes to allow steam to escape during popping.
steps.description: This keeps the popcorn from becoming chewy.

steps.headline: Add 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil to the pan (suggested on your package of kernels).
Turn the heat to medium and add two kernels to the pan.
steps.description: When those kernels pop, the oil is hot enough to add the rest.

steps.headline: Add the amount of kernels suggested on the bag to the pan and cover them.
steps.description: If the lid does not have holes, keep it slightly ajar.

steps.headline: Gently shake the pan to keep the kernels from burning.
Keep shaking while the kernels pop.
steps.description: Once the popping slows to a stop, turn off the heat.

steps.headline: Wait a second for any final pops, and then remove the lid away from you to avoid steam.
Immediately pour the popcorn into a bowl, add your seasoning of choice, and enjoy!

text: Quick and Cheap DIY Paper Method Buy some brown paper bags (lunch bags), but make sure the package is labeled as being microwave-safe. Bags not meant for use in the microwave can catch on fire. Pour 1/4 to 1/3 cup kernels to the bag.  Fold the bag over twice. Do not use staples. Place the bag on its side in your microwave.  Cook on high for several minutes. This time varies, depending on your microwave. Do not leave the bag unattended. Stop the microwave when the pops are about 2 seconds apart, and remove the bag from the oven. Pour the popcorn into a bowl and top it with butter and/or seasoning(s).  Store-Bought Microwave Popcorn Method Buy your favorite popcorn.  Follow the instructions on the bag, which typically recommend the following: Massage the bag with your fingertips to break up the mixture before placing it in a microwave. Set the microwave for a few seconds longer than recommended, listen carefully, and stop the microwave when the pops are about 2 seconds apart. Remove the popcorn from the bag immediately for flavor. Open the bag away from you (the steam is hot), then serve and enjoy! Old-Fashioned Stovetop Method Use a pan with a lid, preferably a lid with holes to allow steam to escape during popping. This keeps the popcorn from becoming chewy. Add 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil to the pan (suggested on your package of kernels).  Turn the heat to medium and add two kernels to the pan. When those kernels pop, the oil is hot enough to add the rest. Add the amount of kernels suggested on the bag to the pan and cover them. If the lid does not have holes, keep it slightly ajar. Gently shake the pan to keep the kernels from burning.  Keep shaking while the kernels pop. Once the popping slows to a stop, turn off the heat. Wait a second for any final pops, and then remove the lid away from you to avoid steam.  Immediately pour the popcorn into a bowl, add your seasoning of choice, and enjoy!
